front.title: More Secure IPv6 Routing Header Processing

abstract.t: The original IPv6 Type 0 Routing Header has been deprecated due to the security risk of a packet forwarding loop being formed, by specifying a large sequence of alternating IPv6 node addresses to visit. This memo proposes a method to prevent these forwarding loops forming, allowing the IPv6 Type 0 Routing Header to be more securely and safely used. The method is also more generally applicable to any unicast source routing.
